verses.roman:
bhakta-gaṇa ākaṇṭha bhariyā karila bhojana
'hari' dhvani kari' uṭhi' kailā ācamana

synonyms: bhakta-gaṇa—all the devotees; ākaṇṭha—up to the neck; bhariyā—filling; karila bhojana—took prasāda; hari dhvani—chanting of the holy name of Hari; kari'-doing; uṭhi'-getting up; kailā ācamana—washed their mouths and hands.
translation: All the devotees took prasāda, filling themselves to the brim. Thereafter, chanting the holy name of Hari, they stood up and washed their hands and mouths.
